caption: Perfection in a pandemic (and after too I'm sure!). Who knew it was possible!? So happy to have such wonderful food and wine options in upper Manhattan, and everyone who works there is so knowledgeable and kind. Bonus: so many available gluten free or veggie options, both in the market and on the menus.

Service was great and they have a good no contact system in place but it seems a little archaic to be charging extra for vegan options these days. They charge $3 extra for vegan flatbread that does not have any kind of alternative cheese. It was delicious but still... why?
An excellent space with the friendliest staff. An impeccable selection just ices the cake. I'll be looking forward to a weekly shop here for the foreseeable future.
Great selection of food and beverages.  Exceptionally helpful staff.

So good. Have been meaning to try it for a long time and can’t wait to introduce more of my friends to it.  Delicious locally-sourced food, diverse and excellent wine selection, smart and friendly service, and just a great welcoming energy to the whole place. Perfect for a long dinner or a quick stop for a glass of vino. Highly recommend.
Delicious food!
(Translated by Google) Good wines, not so much food  (Original) Buenos los vinos, la comida no tanto
Lovely intimate place - like a friend is cooking you a dinner with love and care. And the range of interesting wines offered is simply amazing.

My girlfriend and I celebrated our third year anniversay at this lovely cozy restaurant. We absolutely loved it!! The service was phenomenal, Helen the Manager was so engaging and kind. Made us smile throughout the night. The Chef made scrumptious dishes and explained each one to us. He clearly loves his work. I highly reccomend.
Lovely people surrounded by meticulously curated wine, accompanied with tasty dishes that make you feel like you took a quick visit to Europe. A gem in Inwood, cheers!
We had the Chef’s Supper - Omnivorous & it was exquisite. The chef explained the background of each of the four courses as they were presented at our table. Definitely worth the five star rating.
Beautiful food ethos and very nice selection of local cheeses and wines. The chef's choice dining style is really cool but I didn't partake in it on this visit; I look forward to doing so!
A lovely little spot that combines a local personal touch with worldly knowledge and selection. Amazing and unique wine selection, delicious food, pleasant ambiance, and great people.
A lovely little wine bar a must go to.
Great staff.   All locally sourced ingredients.  Wonderful wine.   Make a trip uptown to visit this place.  You'll be glad you did.
Good selection of wine. Had the cheese and meat plate along with it. Was a little pricey, but the quality was high. Friendly service.

Waitstaff was very knowledgeable about the wines and cuisine. This is not your normal wine bar.  Wines offered here are gems and not mainstream. The variety of wines they offer are unique and flavorable. Also, since they offer half glasses, it enables you to try different varietals. I will definitely visit again.

The food and wine are lovely, but who can afford it? It’s overpriced for this area.  They do not clarify the different prices on their menu regarding a splash, a glass, etc. We thought we were paying $8 per glass, but it is $8 per splash and $17 per glass.  Last year, we went for a late night Happy Hour. Our bartender sold us a more expensive wine with the idea we would be getting a “deal” because it was Happy Hour. We assumed that Happy Hour meant we would be paying less than $10 a glass, and we should have clarified. Happy Hour is only $2 off the original price of $17. For 4 glasses of wine we paid over $60+tax and saved $8. Ridiculous. We might as well buy an incredible bottle of wine and drink at home one block down.  I brought a group of over 20 people here one time with idea of it possibly being a monthly meet-up. The feedback I got was that it was too expensive. The second month 6 people came. We moved the get-together. Not that this really matters, but they didn’t comp me even a “splash” for bringing the group in the first place.  After our $42 bill for two mediocre glasses of wine on Tuesday night (which we stupidly thought were $8 each), we are crossing Tannat off our list.

My first time here was perfect. However, went back recently for lunch and while the sever and the food were stellar what appeared to be the owners walked in while me and my partner were there. Not even a hello or acknowledgement of any sort.  I understand you did not need to be friendly to all however we were the only guests there and were not even acknowledged. A delivery person walked in and greeted us so friendly that it was impossible to overlook what had happened just moments before. It made us feel un-welcomed which is sad because I love the food and the ambience at this spot. Sorry guys but had to say something.
Amazing food, service and little nice beer selection (tins). This place is a little gem.
Great wine, very good farm to table food. Expensive, a little overpriced.

I want to give this place 5 stars, I do, but I can't. The servers were lovely and the owners were friendly and helpful. The wine was very good. I am not a wine connoisseur but I can tell good wine and it was good. The food was an issue for me. I ordered the bread and cheese platter  The cheese was delicious, the bread would have been better if it wasn't so hard. I get that the bread is made of organic ingredients, and I like organic bread, but it shouldn't be so hard to chew. Heating it up would have made it a little softer.  The there were some little drips on the plate that I think were for dipping, but there wasn't enough of the drippings to actually get a decent taste, I think I tasted sort of apple butter, but I'm not sure.  I know these establishments pay a fortune in rent. And I thought the menu was reasonable for the area and reasonable that they are serving homemade farm fresh ingredients  I would rather pay a couple of dollars more and have a decent size portion of the dipping sauces. Maybe it's me, I don't spend a lot of time in wine bars, so perhaps I am ignorant of what a bread and cheese platter should look like. Regardless, I wasn't happy.  I can't really say how I feel about the green soup. I love vegetables, but it didn't have much taste. I think I was expecting something that tasted more savory. It needs something that it's missing.  I want to love this place because it reminds me of the cool, funky places I hung out in in college. The atmosphere is cozy with a decent wine selection. I appreciate what they're trying to offer, butI think the food could be better.

Delicious, well-prepared and thoroughly fresh food sources from small local farms, artfully presented on carefully chosen pottery. Always a delightful surprise with a menu that changes daily! The wines are also really interesting with many unfamiliar grapes and terroir that would satisfy any adventurous wine drinkers (like me!). The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. It is always a treat to visit this absolute neighborhood gem!
Good lord. This gem is the best restaurant in Manhattan north of Daniel!
Food was wonderful. The wine list is amazing and has a lot of rare grapes that you rarely see anywhere... 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟
Great ambience, service and happy hour specials.

My favorite place to go and relax! Everyone here is like family! The wines are different and it’s fun to discover something new. Food is always fresh and delicious! So happy to have this gem in my neighborhood!
If this place were in Chelsea there'd be a five week wait
Great neighbourhood find.
Great addition to the neighborhood! Very interesting wine and beer list and food menu. Everything we tried was great!

Have visited this place many times after visiting The Cloisters as it's a 7 minute walk away. If you want to continue a real artisan experience in the food and wine category, come see William (the owner and self-taught chef) and appreciate a curated food and wine menu with a bucolic experience you can feel.
Amazing wine food atmosphere.   The hosts are wonderful.    I will be back
Interesting wines and delicious bites. Friendly too!

What a great little gem for the neighborhood. I'm a big wine enthusiast, so I am so happy this place exists uptown. The staff is always friendly & the bartender made a great recommendation when I told her I like cabernets. Their food is also pretty great; get anything with vegetables, which I believe are from local farmers. Delicious all around!
Great food and wine selection. Also has a surprisingly good beer selection for a wine bar. Great service, highly recommended.

Tannat Wine & Cheese is me and my husband’s absolute favorite place. ABSOLUTE FAVORITE. Not only is everything there, the wine AND the food, positively delicious, the owners Will and Sarah are a delight! As is the manager, Helen! We go to Tannat as much just to see them as we do for the menu! The atmosphere is so warm and inviting, and every meal there feels so special. If you haven’t gone here yet- you’re missing out! Even if you don’t live close by- this place is worth the subway trip!

Went here at 11 on a Saturday night and was repeatedly told by my server that it was late-night happy hour (really, at 11?). So, my date and I ordered more drinks, assuming that they would be half-off. My date ordered the Pratogrand Colline, which was listed at $7 and $14. She made clear that she wanted the $7 glass, and we both assumed it must have been, because it was quite small when it came out. Great. As the drinks were so tiny and it was "happy-hour," my date ordered 3. When the bill came, we were shocked to see that it was $60. I informed our server that we thought we were getting the smaller of the two glasses (the $7), but she said that the 5.5 oz. glass was the large one. I told her that I felt she had misled us, especially by telling us that it was happy hour numerous times. The atmosphere was nice, but the service was deceitful and done with a smile. Furthermore, there was no attempt to remedy the situation by the manager and we were forced to pay $60. You've lost two customers.
Nice laid back spot!
Just come here. Take the chef's 3 dishes combo, you won't be disappointed!

This place is clearly a labor of love. The 3 people working there were all helpful, knowledgeable about their wines, and friendly. I was just taken aback by the smallness of the portions. They've divided wines by the glass into 2 portion sizes: splashes and pours. This is a great way for people to taste a lot of different things, but it seemed like Wall Street prices at a neighborhood hang out. Ditto the cheese plate. Everything was exquisite other than that. Wonderful and impressive wine selection! To owner: I suspected the organic/sustainable was the cause. Unfortunately I don't live anywhere near enough to make your happy hours :(

A gem of a wine bar in a neighborhood where such gems are rare. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and we felt immediately welcome. The selection of wines is non-traditional but I think that is a strength. Why not get out of your comfort zone and taste something eye-opening?  Didn't have the chance to taste the food but the other patrons  were happy with their plates. Highly recommend

This wine bar opened a few months ago, and since we really enjoy a good glass (or bottle) of wine, we went to check it out. They offer natural wine and genuinely seasonal dining, hence, their menu for both wine and food changes throughout the year, on monthly or even daily bases sometimes. I love that you can get something new every time you visit!  The inside is small, covered with wood from the floor, walls, and furniture, creating cozy and welcoming atmosphere. It has a nice big open door/window at the entrance, looking out to the beautiful greenery. They are across from Fort Tryon Park, and only a short walk from the MET Cloisters museum.  Most of the wines are available by the splash (half the glass), glass, or bottle. They have sparkling, White, Rosé, Red, and Orange. I love the idea of splash, this way, we get to try more wines without too much commitment. Since there were three of us, we each got to try two different kinds of wine, total of 6 splash of different wines. They were all very good, and the staff was very knowledgeable of the wines, so he gave really good recommendations as well.  When you are having good wines, you have to pair it with a good food companions. They offer farm-to-table, working with small Hudson Valley farms. We got Basil Duck Rillettes, Jacuterie Black Truffle Salami, Persian Cucumber, Smoked Trout Toast, and Wild Mushroom Pate. They were all good high quality, tasty and went great with the wines.  The atmosphere was very comfortable, relaxing, cozy and welcoming. They have great wine (and beer) selections from all over the world. It is a great place to try out new wines that you never had opportunity or even heard of. The staff have great knowledge of the wines, we learned a lot from him. He was nice and attentive, he took a good care of us. It was a very nice first visit, I am sure we will return for more in a near future!
At last! A bar in Inwood that doesn’t force me to stare at a TV!!!

The most delicious mushroom I have eaten in my life! Great service. Portions are not big by delicious. Love this place. Steak dish on the photo. The chicken is like natural organic granny’s chicken from the village :)
Beautiful wine bar with awesome owners, welcoming staff, and friendly patrons. Delicious wine and cheese pairings. Highly recommend trying them out.
Wine is amazing (especially $5 rosé happy hour)! Plates are really small and can add up in price, so it’s best experienced before/after a meal.
Great slection of wine and knowledgeable staff.  Food selection is excellent!
Great wine, great housemade cheese. The place has a lot of personality. Glad it's right next to a train stop.
Over priced and not great service. $17 for a glass of wine.
Sarah the owner is well educated on wines.  Their menus change daily with wonderful small plates and interesting cheeses.  Lovely atmosphere and wonderful food and wine!

Excellent locally sourced small bites. The flavors are amazingly well balanced. They don't even have salt and pepper shakers out and I didn't notice it until one of the servers pointed it out. Each dish is so well done that they don't need to be altered with additional seasoning. The wine selection is impeccable, unusual and interesting. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Awesome place to try new wines, small bites to pair them with , cosy atmosphere!

The wine was great, the bartender knowledgeable, the food yummy. But the prices are high, the food (bread and spread in the photo)  not visually attractive.  And let's face it, when you have 3 spreads you need more than 4 slices of bread.

Love this place, Will & Sarah are amazing hosts.   Every wine is carefully thought of  every food item sourced, prepared and seasoned to perfection.  Sarah made all the dishes by herself!   This place is awesome.
Perfect cozy date location right next to the Met cloisters.
A small, cozy place with great small plates and friendly staff!
